result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Charles Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence withheld:  DE placed on 2 years probation.  Conditions of probation:  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Fine/costs $673.50.    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge.

DE has 3 days of jail credit on any sentence imposed if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: $473.50    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
